abstract: Occupy Boston protest site has built a tent library in Dewey Square with growing collection of over 500 books that are lent out with no due dates or late fees; it is one of many several activist encampments, including Occupy Wall Street and sites in Los Angeles and Portland, Ore, to make a library available to the public.
snippet: Occupy Boston is not the only protest site with its own library. In New York, Occupy Wall Street has one, as do encampments in Los Angeles; Portland, Ore and other cities.
lead_paragraph: Occupy Boston is not the only protest site with its own library. In New York, Occupy Wall Street has one, as do encampments in Los Angeles; Portland, Ore and other cities.

headline.main: Occupying Boston and Beyond, With Tent Libraries for All
headline.print_headline: Occupying Boston and Beyond, With Tent Libraries for All
headline.seo: Tent Libraries Occupy Boston and Beyond
